intro: Ornithogalum mekselinae, commonly known as the Mekselina lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves emerging from a basal rosette. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a distinctive, nodding appearance. Ornithogalum mekselinae thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
